meanings.definition: A musical composition inspired by or evocative of the night.
meanings.sent1: The pianist played a beautiful nocturne during the evening concert.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to Chopin's nocturnes before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The nocturne whispered a lullaby to the sleeping city.
meanings.sent4: The nocturne painted the sky with notes of moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the nocturne lingered in the darkness.

meanings.definition: A painting of a night scene.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the serene beauty of the lake in his nocturne.
meanings.sent2: The nocturne on the wall depicted a starry night over the city.
meanings.sent3: The nocturne of the forest made the trees dance under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The nocturne in the gallery seemed to glow with its own light.
meanings.sent5: The nocturne brought the night sky into the living room.

meanings.sent1: The monks gathered in the chapel for their nightly nocturne.
meanings.sent2: She whispered a quiet nocturne before drifting off to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The nocturne of gratitude filled her heart as she looked up at the stars.
meanings.sent4: The nocturne of peace calmed her mind in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The nocturne of hope carried her wishes into the night.
